ternary_plot module#

Created on Thu Nov 2 20:43:59 2023

@author: Shavin Kaluthantri and Derrick Hasterok

class ternary_plot.ternary(ax, labels, plot_type='scatter', style='ternary', grid_spacing=None, tick_spacing=None)#

Bases: object

Initialize the ternary plotting class.

Parameters:

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – Axes object for displaying ternary diagram

  • labels (list of str) – vertex labels

  • plot_type (str, optional) – Defaults to ‘scatter’

  • style (str, optional) – ternary plot style, ternary (triangle) or quaternary (diamond)

  • dg (double, optional) – grid spacing (0,1), Defaults to None

  • dt (double, optional) – tick spacing (0,1), Defaults to None

cplane(a, b, c, ca, cb, cc, p, cp)#

Determines colors for a set of points (a,b,c) within a ternary

Given four colors, one for each vertex of a ternary and a fourth at an arbitrary location within the triangle, the function computes a gradient for any set of points within the triangle.

Parameters:

  • a (np.array) – a coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • b (np.array) – b coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • c (np.array) – c coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • ca (np.array) – color at each vertex a

  • cb (np.array) – color at each vertex b

  • cc (np.array) – color at each vertex c

  • p (np.array) – location of point within ternary

  • cp (np.array) – color at p

Returns:

cval, colors at (a,b,c)

Return type:

np.array

cplanexy(xd, yd, xp, yp, cp, x1, y1, cv1, x2, y2, cv2)#

Fits a plane to (x,y,color) data

Fits a plane using three points in (x,y,color) space and then interpolates the color of know points.

Parameters:

  • xd (np.array) – x Cartesian coordinates for data within ternary

  • yd (np.array) – y Cartesian coordinates for data within ternary

  • xp (double) – x coordinate of point within ternary

  • yp (double) – y coordinate of point within ternary

  • cp (np.array) – color at point within ternary

  • x1 (double) – x coordinate at ternary vertex 1

  • y1 (double) – y coordinate at ternary vertex 1

  • cv1 (np.array) – color at vertex 1

  • x2 (double) – x coordinate at ternary vertex 2

  • y2 (double) – y coordinate at ternary vertex 2

  • cv2 (np.array) – color at vertex 2

Returns:

cval, colors at (a,b,c)

Return type:

np.array

hexagon(bins)#

Creates hexagonal bins within a ternary

Parameters:

n (int) – Hexagonal cell resolution, equivalent to n+1 cells across the bottom ternary axis

Returns:

hexbin, Dictionary of hexagonal bins, including verticies, in Cartesian coordinates and the center of each cell

Return type:

dict

tern2xy(a, b, c)#

Converts ternary (a,b,c) points to cartesian (x,y) coordinates.

The order of the axes are a (top), b (left), and c (right), where the Cartesian origin is defined at the midpoint between b and c.

Parameters:

  • a (np.array) – top vertex coordinates

  • b (np.array) – left vertex coordinates

  • c (np.array) – right vertex coordinates

ternaxes(labels)#

Set up ternary plot axes with optional labeling for a quaternary plot.

Parameters:

labels (list(str)) – List of strings for the labels of the axes.

terncolor(a, b, c, ca=[1, 1, 0], cb=[0.3, 0.73, 0.1], cc=[0, 0, 0.15], p=[0.3333333333333333, 0.3333333333333333, 0.3333333333333333], cp=[])#

Computes colors using a ternary colormap

Given four colors, one for each vertex of a ternary and a fourth at an arbitrary location within the triangle, the function computes a gradient for any set of points within the triangle. Default color scheme is yellow-green-navy.

Parameters:

  • a (np.array) – a coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • b (np.array) – b coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • c (np.array) – c coordinate of data points where color is computed

  • ca (np.array, optional) – color at top vertex, Defaults to [0.3,0.73,0.1]

  • cb (np.array, optional) – color at left vertex, Defaults to [0,0,0.15]

  • cc (np.array, optional) – color at right vertex, Defaults to [1/3,1/3,1/3]

  • p (np.array, optional) – location of point within ternary associated with cp

  • cp (np.array, optional) – color at p, default is [], which will use average of colors

Returns:

cval, colors at (a,b,c)

Return type:

np.array

terngrid(spacing=0.1)#

Adds ternary grid lines to ternary axes.

Updates current ternary axes with tick marks.

Parameters:

  • spacing (double) – Grid spacing. Default is 0.1 units.

  • nvertices (int) – Number of vertices, either 3 or 4.

ternhex(a=None, b=None, c=None, val=None, hexbin_df=None, plotfield=None, bins=10, cmap=None, orientation='horizontal')#

Creates a heatmap from a set of hexgonal bins

Parameters:

  • a (np.array) – locations of points within a ternary system, not needed if hexbin_df is provided, Defaults to None

  • b (np.array) – locations of points within a ternary system, not needed if hexbin_df is provided, Defaults to None

  • c (np.array) – locations of points within a ternary system, not needed if hexbin_df is provided, Defaults to None

  • val (np.array) – a fourth-dimension, compute statistics of val within each hexbin, not supplied if hexbin_df is provided, Defaults to None

  • hexbin_df (pandas.DataFrame) – a data frame containing statistics from a previously call to ternhex, in this case, do not supply a, b, c, or val, Defaults to None

  • plotfield (str) – field in hexbin_df to plot, values may include [‘n’, ‘mean’, ‘median’, ‘std’] if None, no plot is produced, but hexbin_df is returned, Defaults to None

  • bins (int) – resolution factor (bins+1 hexagons across bottom axis)

  • cmap – colormap, Defaults to None

  • orientation (str) – orientation of colormap, ‘horizontal’ (default) or vertical

ternmap(x, y, a, b, c, ca=[1, 1, 0], cb=[0.3, 0.73, 0.1], cc=[0, 0, 0.15], p=[0.3333333333333333, 0.3333333333333333, 0.3333333333333333], cp=[])#

Generates a raster map colored by position within a ternary plot.

ternscatter(a, b, c, d=None, size=36, cmap=None, color=None, categories=None, labels=False, alpha=1, marker='o', edgecolors='none', ax=None, orientation='horizontal')#

Scatter plot data on ternary axes.

Ternary scatter plot, ternscatter() uses many of the same parameters as matplotlib scatter.

Parameters:

  • a (np.array) – coordinate associated with top vertex

  • b (np.array) – coordinate associated with left vertex

  • c (np.array) – coordinate associated with right vertex

  • d (np.array, optional) – coordinate associated with bottom vertex (diamond plot)

  • size (double, optional) – Marker size (in points), Defaults to 36

  • cmap (matplotlib.Colormap) – Colormap, Defaults to None

  • color (optional) – Defaults to None

  • edgecolors (optional) – Defaults to None

  • marker (str, optional) – Symbol used for plotting, Defaults to ‘o’

  • categories (optional) – Defaults to None

  • labels (bool, optional) –

Returns:

t, scatter plot object, legend (if applicable)

ternticks(spacing=0.1)#

Adds ternary tick marks to ternary axes.

Updates current ternary axes with tick marks.

Parameters:

spacing (double) – Distance between tick marks.

xy2tern(x, y)#

Converts cartesian (x,y) points to ternary (a,b,c) coordinates.

The order of the axes are a (top), b (left), and c (right), where the Cartesian origin is defined at the midpoint between b and c.

Parameters:

  • x (np.array) – x coordinates

  • y (np.array) – y coordinates
